subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Question, How to get the U sound in "Up"?
msgSnippet: Fantastic! First, of course MP3 files are easy, I m on  a Mac.  Everything is easy. I just have to make allowances for PC users. wav files are good too. aiff
messageBody:
Fantastic!

First, of course MP3 files are easy, I'm on a Mac. Everything is easy. I
just have to make allowances for PC users. wav files are good too. aiff is no
problem if you want to do the compressions yourself.

However, I had already been to your site. The links to
"http://victorian.fortunecity.com/vangogh/555/Spell/" don't work. This was
part of my frustration. fortunecity doesn't know vangogh at all.

So we have a couple of ways to go from here. Either we can create ".wav"
files for your site so you don't have to rely on anyone else, which fixes
both of our problems, or we can simply exchange the recordings as I suggested.

I look forward to your response and am eager to co-operate with you in these
regards.

begin quote>>>
The technology makes the creation of MP3 files very simple.
The recorder is available at www.talksender.com
Any MP3 player will play the files. Talksender automates the
process of inserting the audio clip in your email.

I see no reason for pronouncing 40 sounds.
These are already pronounced on several pages including
my www.unifon.org/saunds-eng.html

Pick out ten words that are difficult for some reason and we will
work with those.
<<< end quote
